pterygopichthys: A type of exotic, armored fish, characterized by its unusual appearance and ability to thrive in inland waters, often mistakenly identified as a different species, yet possessing distinct physical features and coloration that set it apart from others of its kind, with a tendency to establish itself in new regions.
